title: Progress Tracker - Usage Examples
description: Common usage patterns and example configurations for scroll progress indicators, reading progress bars, and content navigation trackers

validationRules: block_id is required and must be unique 4-character hex string
progressType must be 'horizontal', 'vertical', or 'circular'
When progressType='horizontal': horizontalPos required ('top' or 'bottom'), hzDirection ('ltr' or 'rtl')
When progressType='vertical': verticalPos required ('left' or 'right')
When progressType='circular': circularPos required (6 options: top-left, top-right, center-left, center-right, bottom-left, bottom-right)
applyTo must be 'entire' (full page) or 'custom' (CSS selector)
When applyTo='custom': unqSelector is required (CSS selector string)
pinPoint enables pin points (boolean)
When pinPoint=true: pinPStyle required ('style-1' for labels, 'style-2' for dots), pinPointRep array with items
pinPointRep items require _key, Title, and conID (element ID to track)
percentageText enables percentage display (boolean)
When percentageText=true: percentageStyle required ('style-1' inline, 'style-2' badge)
Circular: circleSize is number string (pixels), cTrackColor and cFillColor for strokes
Circular: position offsets (cPosTopOff, cPosBottomOff, cPosLeftOff, cPosRightOff) based on circularPos
Horizontal/Vertical: trackSize for thickness, trackBG and fillBG for backgrounds
trackBG, fillBG, pinBG, pinHBG, pinABG require openBg=1 for backgrounds
Pin states: normal, hover (H), active (A) - separate styling for each
pinDotSize, pDotBG, pDotBdr, pDotRadius only apply to pinPStyle='style-2'
relTselector uses relative selector for custom tracking (boolean)
trackOffset positions track away from viewport edge (responsive)
warnings: Don't forget _key field in pinPointRep array items
conID must match actual element IDs on the page (case-sensitive)
Don't use percentageStyle='style-2' with progressType='circular' (conflicts visually)
hzDirection='rtl' fills right-to-left (for RTL languages or special effects)
Custom selector (applyTo='custom') requires valid CSS selector in unqSelector
Pin points only work with horizontal and vertical types (not circular)
circularPos offsets depend on position (top-left uses cPosTopOff/cPosLeftOff, etc.)
Don't use conflicting offsets (e.g., top-left position with cPosBottomOff)
percentageText appears at current scroll position on track (may overlap pins)
pinPStyle='style-2' shows dots with labels on hover (style-1 shows labels always)
trackSize applies to all types (horizontal/vertical thickness, circular stroke width)
Circular SVG size is circleSize + (trackSize * 2) to accommodate stroke
Pin active state triggers when section is in viewport (Intersection Observer)
Multiple pins can be active simultaneously if sections overlap in viewport
unqSelector with relTselector uses relative positioning (experimental)
trackOffset only works with horizontal top/bottom and vertical left/right
Percentage text displays current scroll percentage (0-100%)
Admin bar compatibility: tracker adjusts for WordPress admin bar automatically
commonMistakes: Using conID that doesn't match actual page element IDs
Using openBg=0 while trying to set background colors (must be openBg=1)
Not setting openTypography=1 before using typography values
Using pinDotSize with pinPStyle='style-1' (only works with style-2)
Trying to use pin points with progressType='circular' (not supported)
Setting both cPosTopOff and cPosBottomOff for same circular position (conflict)
Using percentageStyle='style-2' with circular progress (creates visual overlap)
Forgetting to set fillBG (progress won't be visible)
Using trackSize without unit (needs md and unit: 'px')
Setting hzDirection='rtl' unintentionally (causes unexpected right-to-left fill)
Not testing conID values on actual page (non-existent IDs silently fail)
Using very large circleSize (>100px) on mobile (overlaps content)
Not providing responsive values for circular offsets on mobile
Setting pinOffset too large (pins appear far from track)
Using identical normal/hover/active styles (no visual feedback)
Forgetting openShadow=1 before setting shadow values
Using relTselector without understanding relative selector behavior
bestPractices: Use horizontal top bar for article reading progress
Use vertical left/right for long-form content or documentation
Use circular bottom-right for minimal, unobtrusive progress
Match fill color to site brand colors
Use subtle track backgrounds (#f3f4f6 or similar)
Add shadows to circular progress for depth (cTrackDShadow)
Provide clear visual feedback for pin states (normal vs hover vs active)
Use pinPStyle='style-1' for navigation, style-2 for minimalist designs
Keep conID values short and semantic (e.g., 'intro', 'features', not 'section-1-intro-text')
Test pin points with actual page content to ensure IDs match
Use percentageStyle='style-2' for horizontal/vertical (badge looks better)
Use percentageStyle='style-1' for circular (inline text in circle)
Provide responsive offsets for circular on mobile (avoid screen edges)
Use gradient fills for modern, eye-catching progress bars
Keep trackSize between 3-8px for horizontal/vertical (too thick is distracting)
Use circleSize 50-70px for desktop, 40-50px for mobile
Provide hover effects on pin points for interactivity cues
Use active state styling to clearly show current section
Test custom selectors (applyTo='custom') thoroughly before deploying
Use trackOffset to avoid overlapping with fixed headers
Match percentage text color to fill color for cohesive design
Use uppercase typography for pin labels (more readable at small sizes)
Provide letter-spacing for uppercase text (0.3-0.5px)
Use border radius on track for polished appearance
Add subtle box shadows for depth without being overwhelming
Test on all devices (mobile, tablet, desktop) for positioning
Use hzDirection='rtl' only for actual RTL languages or intentional effects
Keep pin point titles concise (1-2 words max)
Use consistent pin spacing (pinOffset) for visual rhythm
Test scroll behavior with different content lengths

accessibilityNotes: Progress tracker is purely visual (doesn't affect keyboard navigation)
Pin points should not be the only way to navigate content (provide table of contents)
Use semantic section IDs in conID for better screen reader compatibility
Ensure sufficient color contrast for percentage text (WCAG AA: 4.5:1)
Pin point labels should be descriptive (not just 'Section 1')
Don't rely solely on color to indicate active pin (use borders, shadows, scale)
Test with screen readers to ensure progress doesn't interfere with content
Circular progress with percentage should have aria-label describing purpose
Pin points should be clickable for keyboard users (focus states)
Ensure progress tracker doesn't block content on small screens
performanceConsiderations: Uses Intersection Observer for pin point tracking (efficient)
Scroll event listener for progress calculation (throttled)
SVG for circular progress (better than canvas for small sizes)
Limit pin points to 10-15 max (more causes performance degradation)
Use CSS transforms for smooth animations (GPU-accelerated)
Avoid very complex gradients in fillBG (use 2-3 colors max)
Test custom selector performance with large DOM trees
Circular drop shadow (cTrackDShadow) can impact rendering (use sparingly)
Multiple progress trackers on same page may conflict (use one per page)
Pin point hover effects should be CSS-based (not JavaScript)
